name: Sheraton Albuquerque Uptown

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our family (2 adults, 1 baby) stayed here for just one night, but thought it was one of the nicest hotels we've ever visited. The decor and lighting was very elegant, the beds were super comfortable, and the hotel as a whole was very clean. The best part of our stay was one of the customer service representatives, Mandy. She went above and beyond to fulfill our special requests, and make our stay an incredibly pleasant one. We'll definitely be back again!!
reviews.title: Awesome customer service!

reviews.text: Ok, maybe I didn't look close enough, but what hotel these days doesn't have SOME sort of continental breakfast? If you want it, you have to pay an extra $15/day to get to be a Club Member. Another thing you have to pay for is the internet. $10/day. I'm sorry, but I guess I feel I pay enough to not have to pay for those things when I get there. If you want to be a more upper class hotel, then be upfront with your patrons and charge them for things they use in your rooms up front so they know what they're getting into...Don't get me wrong, it was nice enough, but that just made me mad. The kids had fun in the pool , the beds were supper comfy, and didn't end up using it in the end, but they've got a restaurant and bar too. I also have to say if you're doing lots of shopping in Uptown, it's pretty close to lots of stuff.
reviews.title: A little angry

reviews.text: ESPN Being the host for the GILDAN NEW MEXICO BOWL (NCAA FOOTBALL BOWL GAME), We rely alot on our vendors, restaurants and hotels to make the teams stay enjoyable. The SHERATON staff go's way out of their way to make it a memorable experience. The amentities, rooms, great food and location will bring you back to ALBUQUERQUE and THE SHERATON UPTOWN. I highly recommend.
reviews.title: Great for large groups

reviews.text: CARY COLBERT ESPN REGIONAL TELEVISION
reviews.title: Impressive Customer Service

reviews.text: As a member of a planning committee for a national conference occurring at the Sheraton Albuquerque Uptown, I not only enjoyed staying at the Sheraton, but witnessed several instances of ABOVE AND BEYOND customer service from the staff. Clearly they were on "our team" in ensuring our conference went off without a hitch. A few examples? Accepting boxes early so I didn't have to tote them around, all hands on deck to flip rooms quickly and efficiently, facilitating early check-in so my gear would be stowed out of the way. On one occasion, we saw a staff member literally RUNNING to see what else needed to be done!! Even though our event added 400 people to those visiting the Sheraton, restrooms were always clean and ready for break times. Awesome team!!
reviews.title: Sheraton Albuquerque welcomed our dog

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for one night on the way back from the Grand Canyon. Despite the "old Sheraton" signage on the outside, this place has a very modern interior with well-appointed rooms and common areas. We were upgraded to a very nice jacuzzi suite which came in handy given the long drive. As a platinum Starwood member, the recognition was great here. I would highly recommend this Starwood property.
reviews.title: Great modern hotel, friendly staff, attractive rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had an occassion to stay at the Sheraton last weekend. I must say that it was VERY nice. The bed was the best I've slept on in...anywhere. We found the staff to be extreemly helpful and friendly in all regards. Mandey Simpson with guest services was especially helpful in helping us decide where to sight see to make the most of our brief stay in Albuquerque. Definitely recommend it to all.
reviews.title: Very Nice

reviews.text: I stayed in this building years ago when it was Ramada and the improvement is striking - bathroom fixtures, carpets, service! Great.
reviews.title: Wow

reviews.text: The hotel is very modern looking. The room was great as was the bar area. We actually had dinner and breakfast in the hotel and the food was delicious!
reviews.title: Nice!!

reviews.text: The staff was friendly throughout the hotel.
reviews.title: Great stay, been back twice.

reviews.text: Really great hotel. I've stayed in numerous hotels in Albuquerque and this by far is the best. Staff was incredibly friendly. Took minimal time to check in and was offered assistance with my baggage. Room was clean, comfortable, and luxurious. We had dinner in the hotel restaurant and the food was delicious and the service was impeccable. Also, the price of the room is beyond reasonable. Love this place and am all ready staying there again.
reviews.title: AWESOME

reviews.text: A very conveniently located hotel, with a very friendly staff. We stayed there for just one night, while traveling west, but thought the hotel was very nice. As SPG members we got upgraded to the club level. The room was very spacious, perfectly clean, and the beds super confortable. A pleasant experience.
reviews.title: Very Nice Hotel, Very Friendly Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Sheraton Uptown is a great hotel in a great part of Albuquerque. Its close to shopping and restaurants (try Charlies Backdoor). The hotel is newly remodeled and is very pleasing. The rooms are very comfortable. The staff are friendly and very helpful. Special consideration is given to Starwood Preferred Gust members. The Sheraton Uptown provides a great hotel value in Albuquerque.
reviews.title: While in Albuquerque we always stay at the Sheraton Uptown

reviews.text: very welcoming staff, clean room, nice room, pool refreshing, friendly staff at desk, will be back for future stays
reviews.title: great stay again

reviews.text: My daughter and I have stayed here four times on two different trips to and from Phoenix and Denver. We both commented on how comfortable the beds and pillows were. We will definitely be staying here again. There is a restaurant but we've never eaten there since we arrive late.
reviews.title: Best Sleep I've Ever Had

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was on a five day trip through New Mexico with my spouse. I chose the hotel based on the trip advisor rankings. Here are my thoughts;
reviews.title: I Really Wanted To Like This Hotel

reviews.text: Check In- It was about 8 pm and being a Starwood Gold Member I went to that line. While waiting in line two men rushed to the counter and said that they had to check in immediately. The reservation clerk checked them in and they were assigned to the 8th floor which is the club level. I however was not recognized as a gold member but was checked in by a young lady at the other counter and given in a room on the sixth floor. When we got to the 6th floor none of the keys worked so I had to go downstairs again. Not a good check-in experience. Strike one.
reviews.title: Enjoyed the stay

reviews.text: The Lobby- The lobby of the hotel is very nice and modern. There is a bar and several rooms where meetings and conferences are held.
reviews.title: Excellent Stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Room- The room was well laid out and had super comfortable beds. While another reviewer indicated that he was given a free bottle of water the two bottles in the room cost $ 3.00 each. There is Starbucks coffee in the room which is nice. Very nice shower and bathroom layout.
reviews.title: Just OK

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Sleep- The beds were great and very comfortable. At 8:30 a.m. a maid knocked on the door. While she didn't appear to be on duty she asked if her friend was sleeping there! Not a good experience at all!
reviews.title: Best price, can't beat the quality

description: Nestled in the heart of Albuquerque's uptown business district, our Sheraton Albuquerque Uptown hotel is minutes away from the Albuquerque INTL Sunport, the University of New Mexico, and much more.
